p.s: Piyaz refers to onion in Bengali and indicates that this appetizer ’s main ingredient is onions .
This recipe originated in South Asia and is made in many South Asian households .

list.item: 1 cup of red lentils ( or other types )
2 cups of vegetable oil ( or another oil )

item.s: Chili peppers
Wash one cup of lentils and let it soak in a bowl of water for an hour .
This will make them soft .
Rinse the lentils thoroughly with water .
Prepare a bowl to add the next ingredients in .
Wash it and rinse it clean .
Blend the lentils until it becomes a thick paste .
Use a blender or immersion blender on low .
Scoop out the lentil puree into the bowl with a spoon .
Peel and dice an onion .
Remove the tip and the root of the onion .
Cut the onion in half and start dicing .
Put it into the bowl .
Put a teaspoon of salt into the bowl .
Add more if you would like .
Put a teaspoon of red chili powder .
Red chili powder is to give the lentil puree spice .
Adjust the amount of spice to your liking .
Put in one teaspoon of curry powder .
This adds a bit of seasoning and just enough spice .
Put one teaspoon of coriander powder .
Coriander powder is used to give the Piyazi aroma and a savory taste .
Put in half a teaspoon of cumin powder .
Cumin powder is used to give the Piyazi fragrance .
Put in half a teaspoon of turmeric powder .
This gives the Piyazi some color .
Mix all the ingredients together using your hands .
Wash your hands before so that they 're clean .
Put two cups of oil in frying pan and let the oil heat up on medium heat for two to three minutes .
Use any cooking oil of your choice , preferably vegetable oil .
Put the lentil paste into the frying pan in a circular shape .
Roll the lentil paste into a bite-sized ball with both hands .
Use both hands and flatten the ball into a small patty , no bigger than the palm of your hand .
Fry each side of the lentil paste for 15 minutes or until it becomes golden brown and hardened on each side .
Be sure the Piyazi is cooked thoroughly , or else it will be raw and too watery inside .
It should be crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside .
Wait 30 more minutes .
Take the Piyazi out of the frying pan .
Pat the Piyazi with paper towels to rid it of excess oil .
Let the Piyazi cool for a few minutes before enjoying a delicious snack .
Garnish the dish with chili peppers .
